channel.title: A new form of yell (for owner use only) [EDITED]
channel.description:
okay well in some servers, the owner has an ::lupdate command set... and also ::rules, and even some owners (the lagit ones) like to keep their players updated on their server such as What's New, What's Coming up, and other things such as this... I am one of those owners that likes to keep my players up-to-date on what I'm doing, but for some reason the ::yell command doesnt seem to cut it for these stupid noobs... okay here's my scenario
I type in ::yell Hey there everyone, I'm about the update the sever in 5 minutes, so everyone please finish what you're doing... Then I do the same thing for 4 minutes (I don't just sit there staring at the clock, I'm testing the final update that I'm going to add and compile it to the server at about 1-2 minutes left...) and every 3 minutes, and every 2 minutes and 1 minute, until I send the final message telling people that the server will be up in about 1 minute after I re-compile and then run the server again... So then I run the server again, and I see that I have lost some people, and then I get a whole bunch of faggots running around saying "OMG I was right in the middle of pking someone!" and "I just lost all of my shit!" and other things... And they seem to totally ignore the fact that I have just updated a HUGE Clan Wars glitch, and that I have updated a HUGE Pking glitch... but all they care about is that they lost their fucking items because they can't read worth shit!
[s]So what I want is a way to use "sendQuest" in an alert instead me having to use ::yell all of the time and the stupid noobs complaining because I didnt warn them... is there a way that I could do this?[/s]
Thanks to Retard Monkey's idea, I've decided to change my original task from the "sendQuest" alert to the alert that is used in real Runescape... Now I want to make a command like ::updatestart and what this would do is make a countdown timer in the corner of the screen saying "Update in - 5:00" and it would count down until 0:01, then the server would turn off by itself until I ran the server again... also, just so I don't end up fucking up, I also need to make a command like ::updateabort which would stop the countdown timer and then say "Update - Aborted" in the corner of the screen, also I could have ::updatepause which would pause the timer, and maybe even have ::updateinfo which would create another interface underneath the countdown timer, but it could be like the yell command... so it would go like this... ::updateinfo "I am going to be updating a few Clan Wars glitches, and some Pking glitches as well" so that way the players would know what I'm updating... so if anyone would like to help out like maybe give me a head start or a push in the right direction, it would be greatly appreciated (btw, I will give credits to those that help me)

item.title: A new form of yell (for owner use only) [EDITED]
item.dc:creator: @00rYn00 00rYn00
item.description:
@00rYn00 wrote:

That’s a pretty good idea! thanks Monkey, I know HOW to put the countdown timer in the corner, and I’m pretty sure I know how to make it count down, but I wouldn’t have the slightest clue as to how I could make it appear there…
I suppose I could make the command like
::updatestart
and make an interface for it in the corner of the screen, but I don’t know how I would send it to all of the players… It would be easy to make it appear, just not for everyone…

so yeah new plan…

Read full topic
item.source: A new form of yell (for owner use only) [EDITED]

item.title: A new form of yell (for owner use only) [EDITED]
item.dc:creator: @Retard_Monkey Retard Monkey
item.description:
@Retard_Monkey wrote:

Well is there any way that you could put the server update in the corner, like they do in real runescape?

Like they have the writing that says ‘Update in 5:00’, and it counts down.
If you could do that, I’d really like the code =D!

Read full topic

item.title: A new form of yell (for owner use only) [EDITED]
item.dc:creator: @00rYn00 00rYn00
item.description:
@00rYn00 wrote:

yeah it does, i tryed changing it to playerHandler.messageToAll.sendQuest(""); but it still doesnt work… so I need to use the same format i think as yell, only make it in sendQuest form… someone tell me if that would work please

Read full topic

item.title: A new form of yell (for owner use only) [EDITED]
item.dc:creator: @Cyp_import10 Cyp_import10
item.description:
@Cyp_import10 wrote:

meis it doesnt work, it just laggs out the server, it compiles and runs perfectly but it gives an error ingame…

java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "ll UPDATING SERVER" at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException. java:48) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:447) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:497) at client.customCommand(client.java:12877) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:21983) at client.packetProcess(client.java:17552) at client.packetSending(client.java:17505) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:153) at server.main(server.java:47)

Read full topic
item.source: A new form of yell (for owner use only) [EDITED]

item.title: A new form of yell (for owner use only) [EDITED]
item.dc:creator: @meiscooldude meiscooldude
item.description:
@meiscooldude wrote:

[code]if(command.startsWith(“updateall”) && command.length() >= 10 && playerRights >= 2)
{
String toSay = command.substring(10);
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players)

{

	if(p != null)

	{

		client person = (client)p;	
		person.showInterface(297);

		person.sendQuest("!!!! Read Me !!!!", 299);

		person.sendQuest("Close Window", 300);

		person.sendQuest(toSay, 6156);

		person.sendQuest(toSay, 6158);

		person.sendQuest(toSay, 303);

		person.sendQuest(toSay, 301);

		person.sendQuest(toSay, 4444);

		person.sendQuest(toSay, 304);
	}
}

}[/code]

Try that…

Read full topic
item.source: A new form of yell (for owner use only) [EDITED]

item.title: A new form of yell (for owner use only) [EDITED]
item.dc:creator: @gagea2 gagea2
item.description:
@gagea2 wrote:

start:
if (command.equalsignorecase(“yell”) && playerRights >= 3));

end:
} else {
sendMessage(“You Need To Be An Owner To Yell”);
}

Read full topic

item.title: A new form of yell (for owner use only) [EDITED]
item.dc:creator: @00rYn00 00rYn00
item.description:
@00rYn00 wrote:

yeah you know like the opening screen that has all of the info, or like the Quest Completed interface or something to just tell them “HEY DUMBASS!! I’M UPDATING THE FREAKIN SERVER!”

or something but I want to make it a yell command so that way I don’t have to make a pre-set command such as
::updatenoobs4 (which would send them an update telling them that theres an update in 4 minutes) I want to be able to type in something and it show up on their screen)

Read full topic
